TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit TaiwanLunisolarCalendar extends System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar

Docs.summary: Represents the Taiwan lunisolar calendar. As for the Taiwan calendar, years are calculated using the Gregorian calendar, while days and months are calculated using the lunisolar calendar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Taiwan lunisolar calendar works exactly like the Gregorian calendar, except that the year and era are different. The <xref:System.Globalization.TaiwanLunisolarCalendar> class calculates years using the Gregorian calendar, days and months using the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar> class, and recognizes only the current era.
> [!NOTE] > For information about using the <xref:System.Globalization.TaiwanLunisolarCalendar> class and the other calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md).
The <xref:System.Globalization.TaiwanLunisolarCalendar> class is derived from the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar> class, which represents the lunisolar calendar. The <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar> class supports the sexagenary year cycle (which repeats every 60 years) in addition to solar years and lunar months. Each solar year in the calendar is associated with a Sexagenary Year, a Celestial Stem, and a Terrestrial Branch, and these calendars can have leap months after any month of the year.
A leap month can occur after any month in a year. For example, the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.GetMonth%28System.DateTime%29?displayProperty=fullName> method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.GetMonth%2A> method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.
Currently, the <xref:System.Globalization.TaiwanLunisolarCalendar> is not used by any of the cultures supported by the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> class. Therefore, this class can be used only to calculate dates in the Taiwan lunisolar calendar.
Each <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object supports a set of calendars. The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Calendar%2A> property returns the default calendar for the culture, and the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.OptionalCalendars%2A> property returns an array containing all the calendars supported by the culture. To change the calendar used by a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>, the application should set the <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Calendar%2A> property of <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DateTimeFormat%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to a new <xref:System.Globalization.Calendar>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the number of days in the year that precedes the year specified by the property.
Docs.value: The number of days in the year that precedes the year specified by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property returns a constant value of 384.

Docs.summary: Gets the eras that are relevant to the current object.
Docs.value: An array that consists of a single element having a value that is always the current era.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The values in the array returned by this property are numbers that range from 1 to the largest era number. The largest era number is returned in the first array element and the smallest era number is returned in the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetEra(valuetype System.DateTime time) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the era that corresponds to the specified .
Docs.returns: An integer that represents the era specified in the parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum date and time supported by the class.
Docs.value: The latest date and time supported by the class, which is equivalent to the last moment of February 10, 2051 C.E. in the Gregorian calendar.

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum date and time supported by the class.
Docs.value: The earliest date and time supported by the class, which is equivalent to the first moment of February 18, 1912 C.E. in the Gregorian calendar.
